results.title: Effective learning in elementary school
results.creator_credit: George L. George and Sturgis-Grant Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
A teacher in primary school tells of some of her own experiences in making learning more effective. In her class, teacher and pupil work together on the basic skills such as reading and writing. But stronger motivation for learning is derived from unit study projects, which also give pupils opportunities to develop social skills.

results.title: The Eel
results.brief_description: Eel is an important source of Vitamin A, and a popular food in Japan. The life cycle of the eel is illustrated, showing the migration of the baby eels from their oceanic birth places to the coast of Japan, and subsequent life in the streams or in the commercial ponds of the eel farms. The techniques of eel-raising are shown.

results.title: Edwardian newsreel
results.creator_credit: B F I National Film Library
results.brief_description: Records events and personalities during the reign of Edward VII, compiled from contemporary newsreels. The film covers a wide field of events including the funeral of Queen Victoria, and suffragette disturbances, the Delhi Durbar and finally the funeral of Edward V11.

results.title: Education in Tamagawa
results.brief_description: A survey of the Tamagawa educational project, founded in 1929, just outside Tokyo. Children may enrol in the primary school and leave nineteen years later as graduates of the university. The eductational philosophy encourages the fostering of creativity through self-motivated study and the all-round curriculum includes work on the experimental farm as well as cultural and intellectual activities.

results.title: Education for living
results.brief_description:
Episode number 27 of Series “This Modern Age”.
The main changes and developments in education in Britain are reviewed, with flash-backs to the “bad old days”. The film shows what is being done to provide more and better schools and to train the teachers to service them.

results.title: Education?
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The possible future choices for education, ranging from the free schools approach to the use of technology as a teaching supplement are examined. This film is not an in-depth analysis of these issues, but rather is a discussion-raiser for teacher or parent groups looking at issues of alternatives in education

results.title: Editing synchronous sound
results.brief_description: Explains the process of editing motion picture footage, using double system synchronous sound. Shows the use of a clapstick for synchronization cues during shooting and a gang synchronizer to establish internal synchronization points. Illustrates maintenance of synchronization in cutting from one take to another and means of eliminating unwanted sounds. Summarizes the three main points in this type of editing: establishment of synchronisation of cues in shooting, re-establishment in editing, and maintenance during editing

results.title: Editing a film: Synge's 'The Well of the saints'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The principles involved in editing a film are explained, using the film version of John M. Synge’s play “THE WELL OF THE SAINTS”. The role of the editor in film production, and the purpose and result of editing, are described, and both proper and improper techniques are illustrated

results.title: The Edinburgh Festival
results.brief_description: Highlights of the Edinburgh Festivals of 1963 and 1964 closing with one of the most popular items in the Festival, the Military Tattoo on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle. (Awarded a Cup by the Minister of Tourism, 7th International Festival of Tourist Films, Milan, 1966)
